alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 11:10AM CDT until April 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Babcock affecting Wood County. Wolf River at New London affecting Winnebago, Outagamie and Waupaca Counties. Wisconsin River below Wausau affecting Marathon County. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. Wolf River near Shiocton affecting Shawano, Outagamie and Waupaca Counties. For the Yellow River...including Babcock...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Wolf River...including Shiocton, New London, Lake Poygan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wolf River at New London. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Up to a foot of water is surrounding structures along West River Drive in Fremont. Several inches of floodwater begins to cover portions of Burton Road near Pheifer Park. Water is approaching portions of West Wolf Avenue near New London. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Thursday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
